TopicTitle: I dont think that should work like that.... (Re-entry w/o parachutes/fuel)

Articles.Content: I bassically use three layers of fairings and come back down from orbit/space and these things not only dont burn up on the maxium reentry heat, but they also slow you down enough to land safely.

You didn't actually get your speed very high. The highest I noticed on re-entry was about 1200m/sec which is why you experience no heating to speak of. The landing is broken though. The biggest problem with that design for a proper ship is the drag on launch would be much higher than a parachute so it's a very inefficient design. Also you Kerbal can't get out really.
